dct_title_s: A Plan of the City and Environs of New York in North America
dct_description_sm: Coordinates approximate and based on Greenwich meridian.
"Lond. Mag. Apr. 1778" in upper right of Hell Gate view.

Inset maps: [1] Part of the counties of Charlotte and Albany, in the Province of New York; being the seat of war between the king's forces under Lieut. Gen. Burgoyne and the rebel army -- [2] The southern part of the province of New York: with part of the adjoining colonies -- [3] Map of New York I. with the adjacent rocks and other remarkable parts of Hell-Gate. -- [4] East view of Hell Gate, in the Province of New York.
dct_rights_sm: Images from the David Rumsey Map Center's general collections courtesy of Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
